intro: Aster prenanthoides, commonly known as the small-flowered aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, producing purple to pinkish-blue ray florets. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
